question: Can Isradipine slow progression of Early Parkinson Disease?
ideal_answer: No. In a multicenter, randomized, parallel-group, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial Isradipine did not slow progression of Early Parkinson Disease.

snippets.text: Adjusted least-squares mean changes in total UPDRS score in the antiparkinson medication ON state over 36 months for isradipine and placebo recipients were 2.99 (95% CI, 0.95 to 5.03) points versus 3.26 (CI, 1.25 to 5.26) points, respectively, with a treatment effect of -0.27 (CI, -3.02 to 2.48) point (P = 0.85).
Conclusion: Long-term treatment with immediate-release isradipine did not slow the clinical progression of early-stage PD.
